包.definition: to cover; to wrap; to hold; to include; to take charge of; to contract (to or for); package; wrapper; container; bag; to hold or embrace; bundle; packet; CL:個|个[ge4],隻|只[zhi1]

包乾.definition: to have the full responsibility of a job; allocated task

包乾兒.definition: erhua variant of 包乾|包干[bao1 gan1]

包乾制.definition: a system of payment partly in kind and partly in cash

包二奶.definition: to cohabit with and financially support a mistress

包住.definition: to envelop; to wrap; to enclose

包公.definition: Lord Bao or Judge Bao, fictional nickname of Bao Zheng 包拯[Bao1 Zheng3] (999-1062), Northern Song official renowned for his honesty

包包.definition: bag or purse etc; small bump or pimple; hillock

包含.definition: to contain; to embody; to include

包圍.definition: to surround; to encircle; to hem in

包圓兒.definition: to buy the whole lot; to take everything remaining

包在我身上.definition: leave it to me (idiom); I'll take care of it

包場.definition: to reserve all the seats (or a large block of seats) at a theater, restaurant etc

包夜.definition: to book a service for overnight use (karaoke room, internet café etc); (euphemistic) to hire a companion or escort for the night

包夾.definition: to surround; to hem in; (sports) double-teaming

包子.definition: baozi; bao (steamed stuffed bun); CL:個|个[ge4]

包子有肉不在褶上.pinyin: bāo zi yǒu ròu bù zài zhě shàng
包子有肉不在褶上.definition: a book is not judged by its cover (idiom)

包容.definition: to pardon; to forgive; to show tolerance; to contain; to hold; inclusive

包封.definition: to seal; to close up a package with a seal

包工.definition: to undertake to perform work within a time limit and according to specifications; to contract for a job; contractor

包庇.definition: to shield; to harbor; to cover up

包廂.definition: box (in a theater or concert hall); private room (in a restaurant or karaoke)

包待制.definition: Bao Daizhi, "Edict Attendant Bao", fictional name used for Bao Zheng 包拯[Bao1 Zheng3] (999-1062), Northern Song official renowned for his honesty

包房.definition: compartment (of train, ship etc); private room at restaurant; rented room for karaoke; hotel room rented by the hour

包扎.definition: variant of 包紮|包扎[bao1 za1]

包打天下.definition: to run everything (idiom); to monopolize the whole business; not allow anyone else to have a look in

包括.definition: to comprise; to include; to involve; to incorporate; to consist of

包拯.definition: Bao Zheng (999-1062), Northern Song official renowned for his honesty; modern day metaphor for an honest politician

包換.definition: to guarantee replacement (of faulty goods); warranty

包攬.definition: to monopolize; to take on responsibility over everything; to undertake the whole task

包攬詞訟.definition: to canvas for lawsuits (idiom); to practice chicanery

包月.definition: to make monthly payments; monthly payment

包柔氏螺旋體.pinyin: bāo róu shì luó xuán tǐ

包機.definition: chartered plane; to charter a plane

包河.definition: Baohe, a district of Hefei City 合肥市[He2fei2 Shi4], Anhui

包河區.definition: Baohe, a district of Hefei City 合肥市[He2fei2 Shi4], Anhui

包活.definition: job paid according to the amount of work done; contract work

包涵.definition: to excuse; to forgive; to bear with; to be tolerant

包漿.definition: patina (sheen on the surface of an antique)

包產到戶.definition: fixing of farm output quotas for each household

包產到戶制.definition: system of quotas for farm output per household

包租.definition: to rent; to charter; to rent land or a house for subletting; fixed rent for farmland

包紮.definition: to wrap up; to pack; to bind up (a wound)

包羅.definition: to include; to cover; to embrace

包舉.definition: to summarize; to swallow up; to annex; to merge

包荒.definition: to be tolerant; to be forgiving; to conceal; to cover

包藏.definition: to contain; to harbor; to conceal

包藏禍心.definition: (idiom) to harbor evil intentions; to conceal malice

包被.definition: peridium (envelope or coat of fungi, e.g. puffballs)

包袱.definition: wrapping cloth; a bundle wrapped in cloth; load; weight; burden; funny part; punchline

包袱底兒.definition: family heirloom; most precious family possession; person's secrets; one's best performance

包裝.definition: to pack; to package; to wrap; packaging

包裹.definition: to wrap up; to bind up; bundle; parcel; package; CL:個|个[ge4]

包豪斯.definition: Bauhaus (German school of modern architecture and design)

包辦.definition: to undertake to do everything by oneself; to run the whole show

包辦代替.definition: to do everything oneself (idiom); not to allow others in on the act

包辦婚姻.definition: forced marriage; arranged marriage (without the consent of the individuals)

包退.definition: to guarantee refund (for faulty or unsatisfactory goods)

包退換.definition: to guarantee refund or replacement (of faulty or unsatisfactory goods)

包金.definition: to gild; (old) wages paid to a performer or a troupe by a theater

包銀.definition: contracted payment (esp. actors' salary in former times)

包銷.definition: to have exclusive selling rights; to be the sole agent for a production unit or firm

包間.definition: private room (in a restaurant, or for karaoke etc); parlor; booth; compartment

包青天.definition: Bao Qingtian, fictional nickname of Bao Zheng 包拯[Bao1 Zheng3] (999-1062), Northern Song official renowned for his honesty

包頭市.definition: Baotou, prefecture-level city in Inner Mongolia Autonomous Region 內蒙古自治區|内蒙古自治区[Nei4meng3gu3 Zi4zhi4qu1]

包飯.definition: to get or supply meals for a monthly rate; to board; to provide board

包龍圖.definition: Bao Longtu, ”Bao of the Dragon Image”, fictional name used for Bao Zheng 包拯[Bao1 Zheng3] (999-1062), Northern Song official renowned for his honesty
